Uses of AbstractBasicActivity in com.beepell.activity.basic
 

Subclasses of AbstractBasicActivity in com.beepell.activity.basic
 class Assign
          Assign Activity.
 class Compensate
          The compensate activity causes all immediately enclosed scopes to be compensated in default order (see section 12.5.2.
 class CompensateScope
          The compensateScope activity causes one specified child scope to be compensated.
 class Empty
          There is often a need to use an activity that does nothing, for example when a fault needs to be caught and suppressed.
 class Exit
           The exit activity is used to immediately end the business process instance.
 class Invoke
           The invoke activity is used to call Web Services offered by service providers ...
 class Receive
           A receive activity specifies the partnerLink that contains the myRole used to receive messages and operation that it expects the partner to invoke.
 class Reply
          Reply Activity.
 class Rethrow
           The rethrow activity is used in fault handlers to rethrow the fault they caught, i.e. the fault name and, where present, the fault data of the original fault.
 class Throw
           The throw activity is used when a business process needs to signal an internal fault explicitly.
 class Validate
          The validate activity can be used to ensure that values of variables are valid against their associated XML data definition, including XML Schema simple type, complex type, element definition and XML definitions of WSDL parts.
 class Wait
           The wait activity specifies a delay for a certain period of time or until a certain deadline is reached (see section 8.3.
